defs.name: with_driver_type
defs.docs:
Explicitly set the driver_type. This is not necessary except to trigger
 the other sanity checks in the builder methods if you *really* want a
 specific DriverType to be passed.

attributes.value: / Explicitly set the driver_type. This is not necessary except to trigger
/ the other sanity checks in the builder methods if you *really* want a
/ Panics if adapter or software_module has already been specified and the
/ passed driver_type is not the required value for those configurations.

defs.name: with_adapter
defs.docs:
Instructs Direct3D to create the device on the specified adapter. This
 implicitly sets driver_type to Unknown if it hasn't been set yet.

attributes.value: / Instructs Direct3D to create the device on the specified adapter. This
/ implicitly sets driver_type to Unknown if it hasn't been set yet.
/ Panics if driver_type has already been set to a value other than Unknown

defs.name: with_flags
defs.docs: Pass additional flags to CreateDevice. None are specified by default.

defs.name: BindFlags
defs.docs:
Identifies how to bind a resource to the pipeline.
 
 [More Information][1]
 
 [1]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476085(v=vs.85).aspx

defs.name: VERTEX_BUFFER
defs.docs: Bind a buffer as a vertex buffer to the input-assembler stage.

defs.name: INDEX_BUFFER
defs.docs: Bind a buffer as an index buffer to the input-assembler stage.

defs.name: CONSTANT_BUFFER
defs.docs:
Bind a buffer as a constant buffer to a shader stage; this flag
 may NOT be combined with any other bind flag.

defs.name: SHADER_RESOURCE
defs.docs:
Bind a buffer or texture to a shader stage; this flag cannot be
 used with the [`Map::WriteNoOverwrite`][1] flag.
 
 [1]: enum.Map.html#variant.WriteNoOverwrite

defs.name: STREAM_OUTPUT
defs.docs: Bind an output buffer for the stream-output stage.

defs.name: RENDER_TARGET
defs.docs: Bind a texture as a render target for the output-merger stage.

defs.name: DEPTH_STENCIL
defs.docs: Bind a texture as a depth-stencil target for the output-merger stage.

defs.name: UNORDERED_ACCESS
defs.docs:
Bind an [unordered access][1] resource.
 
 [1]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476335(v=vs.85).aspx

defs.name: DECODER
defs.docs:
Set this flag to indicate that a [2D texture][1] is used to receive
 output from the decoder API. The common way to create resources
 for a decoder output is by calling the ID3D11Device::CreateTexture2D
 method to create an array of 2D textures. However, you cannot use
 texture arrays that are created with this flag in calls to
 ID3D11Device::CreateShaderResourceView.
 
 **Direct3D 11:** This value is not supported until Direct3D 11.1.
 
 [1]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476906(v=vs.85).aspx

defs.name: VIDEO_ENCODER
defs.docs:
Set this flag to indicate that a [2D texture][1] is used to receive
 input from the video encoder API. The common way to create
 resources for a video encoder is by calling the
 ID3D11Device::CreateTexture2D method to create an array of 2D
 textures. However, you cannot use texture arrays that are created
 with this flag in calls to ID3D11Device::CreateShaderResourceView.
 
 **Direct3D 11:** This value is not supported until Direct3D 11.1.
 
 [1]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476906(v=vs.85).aspx

defs.name: CpuAccessFlags
defs.docs:
Specifies the types of CPU access allowed for a resource.
 
 [More Information][1]
 
 [1]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476106(v=vs.85).aspx

defs.name: WRITE
defs.docs:
The resource is to be mappable so that the CPU can change its
 contents. Resources created with this flag cannot be set as
 outputs of the pipeline and must be created with either dynamic
 or staging usage.

defs.name: READ
defs.docs:
The resource is to be mappable so that the CPU can read its
 contents. Resources created with this flag cannot be set as
 either inputs or outputs to the pipeline and must be created
 with staging usage.

defs.name: SINGLETHREADED
defs.docs:
Use this flag if your application will only call methods of
 Direct3D 11 interfaces from a single thread. By default, the
 ID3D11Device object is thread-safe. By using this flag, you
 can increase performance. However, if you use this flag and
 your application calls methods of Direct3D 11 interfaces from
 multiple threads, undefined behavior might result.

defs.name: DEBUG
defs.docs: Creates a device that supports the [debug layer][1].

defs.name: SWITCH_TO_REF
defs.docs: ***Note***  This flag is not supported in Direct3D 11.

defs.name: PREVENT_INTERNAL_THREADING_OPTIMIZATIONS
defs.docs:
Prevents multiple threads from being created. When this flag is
 used with a [Windows Advanced Rasterization Platform (WARP)][1]
 device, no additional threads will be created by WARP and all
 rasterization will occur on the calling thread. This flag is
 not recommended for general use.

defs.name: BGRA_SUPPORT
defs.docs:
Creates a device that supports BGRA formats
 ([`B8G8R8A8Unorm`][1] and [`B8G8R8A8UnormSrgb`][2]).
 All 10level9 and higher hardware with WDDM 1.1+ drivers
 support BGRA formats.

defs.name: DEBUGGABLE
defs.docs:
Causes the device and driver to keep information that you can
 use for shader debugging. The exact impact from this flag will
 vary from driver to driver.

defs.name: PREVENT_ALTERING_LAYER_SETTINGS_FROM_REGISTRY
defs.docs:
Causes the Direct3D runtime to ignore registry settings that
 turn on the debug layer. You can turn on the debug layer by
 using the DirectX Control Panel that was included as part of
 the DirectX SDK. We shipped the last version of the DirectX
 SDK in June 2010; you can download it from the Microsoft
 Download Center. You can set this flag in your app, typically
 in release builds only, to prevent end users from using the
 DirectX Control Panel to monitor how the app uses Direct3D.

defs.name: DISABLE_GPU_TIMEOUT
defs.docs:
Use this flag if the device will produce GPU workloads that
 take more than two seconds to complete, and you want the
 operating system to allow them to successfully finish. If this
 flag is not set, the operating system performs timeout
 detection and recovery when it detects a GPU packet that took
 more than two seconds to execute. If this flag is set, the
 operating system allows such a long running packet to execute
 without resetting the GPU. We recommend not to set this flag
 if your device needs to be highly responsive so that the
 operating system can detect and recover from GPU timeouts. We
 recommend to set this flag if your device needs to perform time
 consuming background tasks such as compute, image recognition,
 and video encoding to allow such tasks to successfully finish.

defs.name: VIDEO_SUPPORT
defs.docs:
Forces the creation of the Direct3D device to fail if the display
 driver is not implemented to the WDDM for Windows 8 (WDDM 1.2).
 When the display driver is not implemented to WDDM 1.2, only a
 Direct3D device that is created with feature level 9.1, 9.2, or
 9.3 supports video; therefore, if this flag is set, the runtime
 creates the Direct3D device only for [feature level][1] 9.1, 9.2,
 or 9.3. We recommend not to specify this flag for applications that
 want to favor Direct3D capability over video. If feature level 10
 and higher is available, the runtime will use that feature level
 regardless of video support.

defs.name: DriverType
defs.value:
pub enum DriverType {
    Unknown = ,
    Hardware = ,
    Reference = ,
    Null = ,
    Software = ,
    Warp = ,
}

defs.name: Read
defs.docs:
Resource is mapped for reading. The resource must have been created
 with read access.

defs.name: Write
defs.docs:
Resource is mapped for writing. The resource must have been created
 with write access.

defs.name: ReadWrite
defs.docs:
Resource is mapped for reading and writing. The resource must have
 been created with read and write access.

defs.name: Discard
defs.docs:
Resource is mapped for writing; the previous contents of the
 resource will be undefined. The resource must have been created
 with write access and dynamic usage.

defs.name: WriteNoOverwrite
defs.docs:
Resource is mapped for writing; the existing contents of the
 resource cannot be overwritten (see [Remarks](#remarks)). This flag
 is only valid on vertex and index buffers. The resource must have
 been created with write access. Cannot be used on a resource
 created with the [`CONSTANT_BUFFER`][1] flag.
 
 [1]: struct.BindFlags.html#associatedconstant.CONSTANT_BUFFER

defs.name: Map
defs.value:
pub enum Map {

    #[doc =
      r" Resource is mapped for reading. The resource must have been created"]
    #[doc = r" with read access."]
    Read = ,

    #[doc =
      r" Resource is mapped for writing. The resource must have been created"]
    #[doc = r" with write access."]
    Write = ,

    #[doc =
      r" Resource is mapped for reading and writing. The resource must have"]
    #[doc = r" been created with read and write access."]
    ReadWrite = ,

    #[doc = r" Resource is mapped for writing; the previous contents of the"]
    #[doc =
      r" resource will be undefined. The resource must have been created"]
    #[doc = r" with write access and dynamic usage."]
    Discard = ,

    #[doc = r" Resource is mapped for writing; the existing contents of the"]
    #[doc =
      r" resource cannot be overwritten (see [Remarks](#remarks)). This flag"]
    #[doc =
      r" is only valid on vertex and index buffers. The resource must have"]
    #[doc = r" been created with write access. Cannot be used on a resource"]
    #[doc = r" created with the [`CONSTANT_BUFFER`][1] flag."]
    #[doc = r" "]
    #[doc = r" [1]: struct.BindFlags.html#associatedconstant.CONSTANT_BUFFER"]
    WriteNoOverwrite = ,
}
defs.docs:
Identifies a resource to be accessed for reading and writing by the
 CPU. Applications may combine one or more of these flags.
 
 [More Information][1]
 
 [1]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476181(v=vs.85).aspx

defs.name: ResourceMiscFlags
defs.docs:
Identifies options for resources.
 
 [More Information][1]
 
 [1]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476203(v=vs.85).aspx

defs.name: Default
defs.docs:
A resource that requires read and write access by the GPU.
 This is likely to be the most common usage choice.

defs.name: Immutable
defs.docs:
A resource that can only be read by the GPU. It cannot be
 written by the GPU, and cannot be accessed at all by the CPU.
 This type of resource must be initialized when it is created,
 since it cannot be changed after creation.

defs.name: Dynamic
defs.docs:
A resource that is accessible by both the GPU (read only) and
 the CPU (write only). A dynamic resource is a good choice for
 a resource that will be updated by the CPU at least once per
 frame. To update a dynamic resource, use a Map method.

defs.name: Staging
defs.docs:
A resource that supports data transfer (copy) from the GPU to
 the CPU.

defs.name: Usage
defs.value:
pub enum Usage {

    #[doc = r" A resource that requires read and write access by the GPU."]
    #[doc = r" This is likely to be the most common usage choice."]
    Default = ,

    #[doc = r" A resource that can only be read by the GPU. It cannot be"]
    #[doc = r" written by the GPU, and cannot be accessed at all by the CPU."]
    #[doc = r" This type of resource must be initialized when it is created,"]
    #[doc = r" since it cannot be changed after creation."]
    Immutable = ,

    #[doc = r" A resource that is accessible by both the GPU (read only) and"]
    #[doc = r" the CPU (write only). A dynamic resource is a good choice for"]
    #[doc = r" a resource that will be updated by the CPU at least once per"]
    #[doc = r" frame. To update a dynamic resource, use a Map method."]
    Dynamic = ,

    #[doc = r" A resource that supports data transfer (copy) from the GPU to"]
    #[doc = r" the CPU."]
    Staging = ,
}
defs.docs:
Identifies expected resource use during rendering. The usage directly
 reflects whether a resource is accessible by the CPU and/or the
 graphics processing unit (GPU).
 
 [More Information][1]
 
 [1]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff476259(v=vs.85).aspx

defs.name: with_unchecked_format
defs.docs:
This flag must be used if you are specifying initial data using a
 format with `pixel_size() == 0`. It disables the safety check that
 initial_data contains enough bytes to fill the texture. Otherwise,
 `build()` will panic if `format.pixel_size() == 0`.
